gui.nebula.config.title: Nebula Particle Configuration
gui.nebula.config.render_in_game.desc:
Control whether particles are rendered during gameplay. When disabled, particle data will not be processed, significantly improving performance.

Note: Even if disabled, particles will still be forcibly rendered when ReplayMod is exporting a video.
gui.nebula.config.show_debug_hud.desc: Display debug information about the particle system (instance count, particle count, buffer status, etc.) in the top-left corner.
gui.nebula.config.show_stats.desc: Show detailed performance statistics (FPS, Instance Count, etc.) in the HUD.
gui.nebula.config.show_charts.desc: Draw real-time performance line charts in the HUD.
gui.nebula.config.blend_mode.desc:
Set the blending mode for particles.

§6Additive§r: Particles glow naturally, best performance, but overlapping areas become too bright.

§6Alpha§r: Accurate colors, suitable for opaque particles, but transparent particles require sorting.

§6OIT§r: Order Independent Transparency, best quality, no sorting needed, but higher performance cost.
gui.nebula.config.culling_behavior.desc:
Sets how particles are handled when outside the field of view.

§6Skip Rendering Only (Recommended)§r: Keeps logic calculations. No delay when entering view, but consumes CPU.

§6Fully Pause§r: Completely stops processing. §cWarning§r: May cause noticeable stuttering when entering view due to data addressing.
gui.nebula.config.emissive_strength.desc: Controls the emissive strength of particles. Higher values make particles glow brighter.
command.nebula.client.reload.failed: Failed to reload animations. See log for details.
